text.headline: History of Cocos Island
text.text: Cocos Island: a tropical treasure 500 miles off the coast of Costa Rica. Explore its rich history in this interactive timeline.

media.caption: Houston's mother and Gospel singer, Cissy Houston (left) and cousin Dionne Warwick.
media.credit:
Cissy Houston photo:Tom Marcello
Dionne Warwick: CBS Television via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Discovery
text.text: Spanish sailor Juan Cabezas creates the first written record of the island.

text.headline: Put it on the map
text.text: Cocos Island first appears on a map delivered to King Henry the II of France by cartographer Nicolas Desliens.

media.caption: A young poised Whitney Houston in an interview with EbonyJet.

text.headline: First Costa Rican presence
text.text: Costa Ricans first visited Cocos Island when President Juan Mora Fern√°ndez sent a ship to rescue a group of Chilean outcasts.

media.caption: I'm Every Women as performed by Whitney Houston.

text.headline: Prison Island
text.text: A prison once stood on Cocos Island.

media.caption: Whitney Houston and Clive Davis discussing her discovery and her eponymous first album.

text.headline: First scientific expedition
text.text: President Rafael Yglesias sent the first scientific expedition to Cocos Island, with scientists Anastasio Alfaro and Henry Pittier.

media.caption: The 'How Will I Know' video showcases the youthful energy that boosted Houston to stardom.

text.headline: Treasure Hunter
text.text: German citizen Augusto Gissler lived on the island treasure hunting. He installed himself there with 13 families.

media.caption: Dionne Warwick gleefully announces cousin, Whitney Houston, the winner of the Best Female Pop Vocal Performance for the song Saving All My Love.

text.headline: National Park
text.text: President Rodrigo Carazo declares Cocos Island a National Park.

media.caption: Cocos National Park
media.credit: my domicile for 15 days" (CC BY 2.0) by jonrawlinson

text.headline: World Heritage Site
text.text: Cocos Island becomes a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

text.headline: World Heritage Site
text.text: Cocos Island becomes a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

text.headline: Historic and Cultural Site
text.text: Cocos Island is declared a Historic and Cultural Site by the Ministry of Culture, Youth and Sports of Costa Rica.
